org.opends.server.protocols.asn1

Interface ASN1Reader

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ASN1ByteChannelReader

    public interface ASN1Reader
extends java.io.Closeable
    An interface for decoding ASN.1 elements from a data source.

    Methods for creating ASN1Readers are provided in the ASN1 class.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes this ASN.1 reader.
      boolean elementAvailable()
      Determines if a complete ASN.1 element is waiting to be read.
      boolean hasNextElement()
      Determines if at least one ASN.1 element is waiting to be read.
      int peekLength()
      Gets the data length of the next element without actually reading the element and advancing the cursor.
      byte peekType()
      Gets the BER type of the next element without actually reading the element and advancing the cursor.
      boolean readBoolean()
      Reads the next ASN.1 element as a boolean and advance the cursor.
      void readEndExplicitTag()
      Finishes reading an explicit tag.
      void readEndSequence()
      Finishes reading a sequence.
      void readEndSet()
      Finishes reading a set.
      int readEnumerated()
      Reads the next ASN.1 element as an enumerated value and advances the cursor.
      long readInteger()
      Reads the next ASN.1 element as an integer and advances the cursor.
      void readNull()
      Reads the next ASN.1 element as a null element and advances the cursor.
      ByteString readOctetString()
      Reads the next ASN.1 element as an octet string and advances the cursor.
      void readOctetString(ByteStringBuilder buffer)
      Reads the next ASN.1 element as an octet string and advances the cursor.
      java.lang.String readOctetStringAsString()
      Reads the next ASN.1 element as an octet string and advances the cursor.

      Reads the next ASN.1 element as an octet string and advances the cursor.

      Reads the next ASN.1 element as an explicit tag.
      void readStartSequence()
      Reads the next ASN.1 element as a sequence.
      void readStartSet()
      Reads the next ASN.1 element as a set.
      void skipElement()
      Advances this ASN.1 reader beyond the next ASN.1 element without decoding it.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes this ASN.1 reader.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • elementAvailable

        boolean elementAvailable()
                         throws ASN1Exception
        Determines if a complete ASN.1 element is waiting to be read.
        Returns:
        true if another complete element is available or false otherwise.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If an error occurs while trying to decode an ASN1 element.

      • hasNextElement

        boolean hasNextElement()
                       throws ASN1Exception
        Determines if at least one ASN.1 element is waiting to be read.
        Returns:
        true if another element is available or false if the EOF is reached.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If an error occurs while trying to decode an ASN1 element.

      • peekLength

        int peekLength()
               throws ASN1Exception
        Gets the data length of the next element without actually reading the element and advancing the cursor.
        Returns:
        The data length of the next element or -1 if the EOF is encountered.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If an error occurs while determining the length.

      • peekType

        byte peekType()
              throws ASN1Exception
        Gets the BER type of the next element without actually reading the element and advancing the cursor.
        Returns:
        The BER type of the next element or -1 if the EOF is encountered.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If an error occurs while determining the BER type.

      • readBoolean

        boolean readBoolean()
                    throws ASN1Exception
        Reads the next ASN.1 element as a boolean and advance the cursor.
        Returns:
        The decoded boolean value.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If the element cannot be decoded as a boolean.

      • readEndExplicitTag

        void readEndExplicitTag()
                        throws ASN1Exception
        Finishes reading an explicit tag. Any elements not read in the explicit tag will be discarded.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If an error occurs while advancing to the end of the explicit tag.

      • readEndSequence

        void readEndSequence()
                     throws ASN1Exception
        Finishes reading a sequence. Any elements not read in the sequence will be discarded.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If an error occurs while advancing to the end of the sequence.

      • readEndSet

        void readEndSet()
                throws ASN1Exception
        Finishes reading a set. Any elements not read in the set will be discarded.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If an error occurs while advancing to the end of the set.

      • readEnumerated

        int readEnumerated()
                   throws ASN1Exception
        Reads the next ASN.1 element as an enumerated value and advances the cursor.
        Returns:
        The decoded enumerated value.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If the element cannot be decoded as an enumerated value.

      • readInteger

        long readInteger()
                 throws ASN1Exception
        Reads the next ASN.1 element as an integer and advances the cursor.
        Returns:
        The decoded integer value.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If the element cannot be decoded as a integer.

      • readNull

        void readNull()
              throws ASN1Exception
        Reads the next ASN.1 element as a null element and advances the cursor.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If the element cannot be decoded as an null element.

      • readOctetString

        ByteString readOctetString()
                           throws ASN1Exception
        Reads the next ASN.1 element as an octet string and advances the cursor.
        Returns:
        The decoded octet string value represented using a ByteString.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If the element cannot be decoded as an octet string.

      • readOctetString

        void readOctetString(ByteStringBuilder buffer)
                     throws ASN1Exception
        Reads the next ASN.1 element as an octet string and advances the cursor. The data will be appended to the provided ByteStringBuilder.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The ByteStringBuilder to append the data to.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If the element cannot be decoded as an octet string.

      • readOctetStringAsString

        java.lang.String readOctetStringAsString()
                                         throws ASN1Exception
        Reads the next ASN.1 element as an octet string and advances the cursor. The data will be decoded to a UTF-8 string. This method is equivalent to: 
         readOctetStringAsString("UTF-8");
        Returns:
        The string representation of the octet string data.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If the element cannot be decoded as an octet string.

      • readOctetStringAsString

        java.lang.String readOctetStringAsString(java.lang.String charSet)
                                         throws ASN1Exception
        Reads the next ASN.1 element as an octet string and advances the cursor. The data will be decoded to a string using the provided character set.
        Parameters:
        charSet - The character set to use in order to decode the data into a string.
        Returns:
        The string representation of the octet string data.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If the element cannot be decoded as an octet string.

      • readStartExplicitTag

        void readStartExplicitTag()
                          throws ASN1Exception
        Reads the next ASN.1 element as an explicit tag. All further reads will read the elements in the explicit tag until readEndExplicitTag() is called.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If the next element is not an explicit tag.

      • readStartSequence

        void readStartSequence()
                       throws ASN1Exception
        Reads the next ASN.1 element as a sequence. All further reads will read the elements in the sequence until readEndSequence() is called.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If the next element is not a sequence.

      • readStartSet

        void readStartSet()
                  throws ASN1Exception
        Reads the next ASN.1 element as a set. All further reads will read the elements in the sequence until readEndSet() is called.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If the next element is not a set.

      • skipElement

        void skipElement()
                 throws ASN1Exception
        Advances this ASN.1 reader beyond the next ASN.1 element without decoding it.
        Throws:
        ASN1Exception - If the next ASN.1 element could not be skipped.
